description:
snap run sickgear
Data directory: /var/snap/sickgear/common/data must be writable (write permissions). Exiting.
Like others said, it doesn't run on 18.10

It's not obvious, but if you look on the project's snapcraft page you'll find the github page (https://github.com/SickGear/SickGear/wiki/Install-SickGear-%5B3%5D-Ubuntu#install) which tells you that you need to run sickgear as root to overcome the data directory permissions error.
This app demos a good example how a launcher opens a terminal and abruptly closes it.
summary: Really good launcher to close a terminal

description: Download it. It opens and closes a terminal. Meh.
I've made the folder world read write execute, Because why not go scorched earth and still can't create show folder in globally accessable dir.
Doesn't even launch, nothing.
after i used sudo in terminal works fine
Works fine! People who don't know how to run the programm have left poor reviews.

Spent several hours trying to figure out file permissions to make this work when installed from Ubuntu Software. Trying to find support gave me a serious craving for a lead aspirin.

I uninstalled and re-installed using the manual method on SickGear's GitHub page. Copied and pasted a dozen lines into Terminal, worked flawlessly.

Once it is installed, it works as advertised to automate obtaining TV shows.
summary: Ubuntu Software package doesn't work! Awesome installed manually

description: just follow the basic instructions

I thought this might be a nice alternative to Popcorn Time. After installation problems I got it to run. I tried two shows. It finds some show info which I then add. Then it shows a calendar and that for a whole week there is no show. What about the alraidy aired shows? I want to see those. No way. This is more like a glorified TV guide. UNINSTALLED.
Popcorn Time is super easy and finds not only ALL Shows, but also practically ALL movies.
follow the given instructions..works great
good effort , innovation
summary: good stuff, just read the fine print

description: thanks for putting in the effort
summary: Great app, read the fine print

description:
Can run SickGear using 'sudo snap run sickgear' from a terminal, 
so it is installed correctly, but can't get it to auto start by following 
the auto start guide for Ubuntu.
I created rc.local in /etc which contains the script 
/snap/bin/sickgear -d
however, sickgear does not start on boot. Please send HALP!
not working

Only one problem I have.
When I try to download show it always gives me an error:
"Unable to add show because can't create folder".
Somebody help with this?
summary: Love easy start and nice look of interface

description:
Why does this software need root permissions to load??
I don't see why I should trust to run this as root.
Depuis une installation fraîche d'Ubuntu, erreur dans la ligne de commande mais pas le temps de voir et aucune envie de débugguer
